member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfModifyWorldTransformMode
member.summary: The ModifyWorldTransformMode enumeration defines modes for using specified transform data to modify the world-space to page-space transform that is currently defined in the playback device context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfModifyWorldTransformMode.MWT_IDENTITY
member.summary: Reset the current transform using the identity matrix. In this mode, the specified transform data is ignored

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfModifyWorldTransformMode.MWT_LEFTMULTIPLY
member.summary: Multiply the current transform. In this mode, the specified transform data is the left multiplicand, and the transform that is currently defined in the playback device context is the right multiplicand

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfModifyWorldTransformMode.MWT_RIGHTMULTIPLY
member.summary: Multiply the current transform. In this mode, the specified transform data is the right multiplicand, and the transform that is currently defined in the playback device context is the left multiplicand

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfModifyWorldTransformMode.MWT_SET
member.summary: Perform the function of an EMR_SETWORLDTRANSFORM record (section 2.3.12.2).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle
member.summary: The PenStyle enumeration defines the attributes of pens that can be used in graphics operations. A pen style is a combination of pen type, line style, line cap, and line join.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_COSMETIC
member.summary: A pen type that specifies a line with a width of one logical unit and a style that is a solid color

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_ENDCAP_ROUND
member.summary: A line cap that specifies round ends.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_JOIN_ROUND
member.summary: A line join that specifies round joins

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_SOLID
member.summary: A line style that is a solid color

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_DASH
member.summary: A line style that is dashed

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_DOT
member.summary: A line style that is dotted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_DASHDOT
member.summary: A line style that consists of alternating dashes and dots

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_DASHDOTDOT
member.summary: A line style that consists of dashes and double dots.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_NULL
member.summary: A line style that is invisible.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_INSIDEFRAME
member.summary: A line style that is a solid color. When this style is specified in a drawing record that takes a bounding rectangle, the dimensions of the figure are shrunk so that it fits entirely in the bounding rectangle, taking into account the width of the pen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_USERSTYLE
member.summary: A line style that is defined by a styling array, which specifies the lengths of dashes and gaps in the line

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_ALTERNATE
member.summary: A line style in which every other pixel is set. This style is applicable only to a pen type of PS_COSMETIC

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_ENDCAP_SQUARE
member.summary: A line cap that specifies square ends.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_ENDCAP_FLAT
member.summary: A line cap that specifies flat ends.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_JOIN_BEVEL
member.summary: A line join that specifies beveled joins.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_JOIN_MITER
member.summary: A line join that specifies mitered joins when the lengths of the joins are within the current miter length limit that is set in the playback device context. If the lengths of the joins exceed the miter limit, beveled joins are specified

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.PS_GEOMETRIC
member.summary: A pen type that specifies a line with a width that is measured in logical units and a style that can contain any of the attributes of a brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.StyleMask
member.summary: The style mask

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.EndCapMask
member.summary: The end cap mask

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.JoinMask
member.summary: The join mask

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPenStyle.TypeMask
member.summary: The type mask

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPointEnum
member.summary: The Point enumeration is used to specify how a point is to be used in a drawing call.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPointEnum.PT_CLOSEFIGURE
member.summary: A PT_LINETO or PT_BEZIERTO type can be combined with this value by using the bitwise operator OR to indicate that the corresponding point is the last point in a figure and the figure is closed

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPointEnum.PT_LINETO
member.summary: Specifies that a line is to be drawn from the current position to this point, which then becomes the new current position

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPointEnum.PT_BEZIERTO
member.summary: Specifies that this point is a control point or ending point for a Bezier curve.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPointEnum.PT_MOVETO
member.summary: Specifies that this point starts a disjoint figure. This point becomes the new current position.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPolygonFillMode
member.summary: The PolygonFillMode enumeration defines values that specify how to calculate the region of a polygon that is to be filled.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPolygonFillMode.ALTERNATE
member.summary: Selects alternate mode (fills the area between odd-numbered and even-numbered polygon sides on each scan line).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfPolygonFillMode.WINDING
member.summary: Selects winding mode (fills any region with a nonzero winding value).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion
member.summary: The Proportion enumeration defines values for one of the characteristics in the PANOSE system for classifying typefaces.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_ANY
member.summary: The Any proportion.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_NO_FIT
member.summary: The No fit.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_PROP_OLD_STYLE
member.summary: Old style.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_PROP_MODERN
member.summary: The modern

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_PROP_EVEN_WIDTH
member.summary: The even width

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_PROP_EXPANDED
member.summary: The expanded

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_PROP_CONDENSED
member.summary: The condensed

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_PROP_VERY_EXPANDED
member.summary: The very expanded

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_PROP_VERY_CONDENSED
member.summary: The very condensed

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfProportion.PAN_PROP_MONOSPACED
member.summary: The mono spaced

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType
member.summary: The RecordType enumeration defines values that uniquely identify EMF records. These values are provided in the Type field of each record.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_HEADER
member.summary: This record defines the start of the metafile and specifies its characteristics; its contents, including the dimensions of the embedded image; the number of records in the metafile; and the resolution of the device on which the embedded image was created. These values make it possible for the metafile to be device-independent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYBEZIER
member.summary: This record defines one or more Bezier curves. Cubic Bezier curves are defined using specified endpoints and control points, and are stroked with the current pen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYGON
member.summary: This record defines a polygon consisting of two or more vertexes connected by straight lines. The polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygon is closed automatically by drawing a line from the last vertex to the first.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYLINE
member.summary: This record defines a series of line segments by connecting the points in the specified array.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYBEZIERTO
member.summary: This record defines one or more Bezier curves based upon the current position.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYLINETO
member.summary: This record defines one or more straight lines based upon the current position. A line is drawn from the current position to the first point specified by the points field by using the current pen. For each additional line, drawing is performed from the ending point of the previous line to the next point specified by points.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYPOLYLINE
member.summary: This record defines multiple series of connected line segments. The line segments are drawn by using the current pen. The figures formed by the segments are not filled. T he current position is neither used nor updated by this record.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYPOLYGON
member.summary: This record defines a series of closed polygons. Each polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygons defined by this record can overlap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETWINDOWEXTEX
member.summary: This record defines the window extent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETWINDOWORGEX
member.summary: This record defines the window origin.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETVIEWPORTEXTEX
member.summary: This record defines the viewport extent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETVIEWPORTORGEX
member.summary: This record defines the viewport origin.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETBRUSHORGEX
member.summary: This record defines the origin of the current brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_EOF
member.summary: This record indicates the end of the metafile.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETPIXELV
member.summary: This record defines the color of the pixel at the specified logical coordinates.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETMAPPERFLAGS
member.summary: This record specifies parameters of the process of matching logical fonts to physical fonts, which is performed by the font mapper.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETMAPMODE
member.summary: This record defines the mapping mode of the playback device context. The mapping mode defines the unit of measure used to transform page space units into device space units, and also defines the orientation of the device's x-axis and y-axis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETBKMODE
member.summary: This record defines the background mix mode of the playback device context. The background mix mode is used with text, hatched brushes, and pen styles that are not solid lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETPOLYFILLMODE
member.summary: This record defines polygon fill mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETROP2
member.summary: This record defines binary raster operation mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETSTRETCHBLTMODE
member.summary: This record defines bitmap stretch mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETTEXTALIGN
member.summary: This record defines text alignment.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETCOLORADJUSTMENT
member.summary: This record defines the color adjustment values for the playback device context using the specified values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETTEXTCOLOR
member.summary: This record defines the current text color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETBKCOLOR
member.summary: This record defines the background color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_OFFSETCLIPRGN
member.summary: This record redefines the clipping region of the playback device context by the specified offsets.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_MOVETOEX
member.summary: This record defines coordinates of the new current position, in logical units.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETMETARGN
member.summary: This record intersects the current clipping region for the playback device context with the current meta region and saves the combined region as the new meta region. The clipping region is reset to a null region.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_EXCLUDECLIPRECT
member.summary: This record defines a new clipping region that consists of the existing clipping region minus the specified rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_INTERSECTCLIPRECT
member.summary: This record defines a new clipping region from the intersection of the current clipping region and the specified rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SCALEVIEWPORTEXTEX
member.summary: This record redefines the viewport for the playback device context using the ratios formed by the specified multiplicands and divisors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SCALEWINDOWEXTEX
member.summary: This record redefines the window for the playback device context using the ratios formed by the specified multiplicands and divisors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SAVEDC
member.summary: This record saves the current state of the playback device context by copying data describing selected objects and graphic modes—including the bitmap, brush, palette, font, pen, region, drawing mode, and mapping mode—to a stack of saved device contexts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_RESTOREDC
member.summary: This record restores the playback device context to the specified saved state. The playback device context is restored by popping state information off a stack of saved device contexts created by earlier EMR_SAVEDC (section 2.3.11) records.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETWORLDTRANSFORM
member.summary: This record defines a two-dimensional linear transformation between world space and page space (for more information, see [MSDN-WRLDPGSPC]) for the playback device context. This transformation can be used to scale, rotate, shear, or translate graphics output.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_MODIFYWORLDTRANSFORM
member.summary: This record redefines the world transformation for the playback device context using the specified mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SELECTOBJECT
member.summary: This record adds an object to the playback device context, identifying it by its index in the EMF Object Table (section 3.1.1.1).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_CREATEPEN
member.summary: This record defines a logical pen that has the specified style, width, and color. The pen can subsequently be selected into the playback device context and used to draw lines and curves.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_CREATEBRUSHINDIRECT
member.summary: This record defines a logical brush for figure filling in graphics operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_DELETEOBJECT
member.summary: This record deletes a graphics object, clearing its index in the EMF Object Table. If the deleted object is selected in the playback device context, the default object for that context property MUST be restored.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_ANGLEARC
member.summary: This record defines a line segment of an arc. The line segment is drawn from the current position to the beginning of the arc. The arc is drawn along the perimeter of a circle with the given radius and center. The length of the arc is defined by the given start and sweep angles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_ELLIPSE
member.summary: This record defines an ellipse. The center of the ellipse is the center of the specified bounding rectangle. The ellipse is outlined by using the current pen and is filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_RECTANGLE
member.summary: This record defines a rectangle. The rectangle is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_ROUNDRECT
member.summary: This record defines a rectangle with rounded corners. The rectangle is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_ARC
member.summary: This record defines an elliptical arc.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_CHORD
member.summary: This record defines a chord (a region bounded by the intersection of an ellipse and a line segment, called a secant). The chord is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_PIE
member.summary: This record defines a pie-shaped wedge bounded by the intersection of an ellipse and two radials. The pie is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SELECTPALETTE
member.summary: This record adds a LogPalette (section 2.2.17) object to the playback device context, identifying it by its index in the EMF Object Table.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_CREATEPALETTE
member.summary: This record defines a LogPalette object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETPALETTEENTRIES
member.summary: This record defines RGB (red-green-blue) color values in a range of entries in a LogPalette object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_RESIZEPALETTE
member.summary: This record increases or decreases the size of a logical palette.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_REALIZEPALETTE
member.summary: This record maps entries from the current logical palette to the system palette.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_EXTFLOODFILL
member.summary: This record fills an area of the display surface with the current brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_LINETO
member.summary: This record defines a line from the current position up to, but not including, the specified point. It resets the current position to the specified point.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_ARCTO
member.summary: This record defines an elliptical arc. It resets the current position to the end point of the arc.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYDRAW
member.summary: This record defines a set of line segments and Bezier curves.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETARCDIRECTION
member.summary: This record defines the drawing direction to be used for arc and rectangle operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETMITERLIMIT
member.summary: This record defines the limit for the length of miter joins for the playback device context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_BEGINPATH
member.summary: This record opens a path bracket in the playback device context.
member.remarks: After a path bracket is open, an application can begin processing records to define the points that lie in the path. An application MUST close an open path bracket by processing the EMR_ENDPATH record. When an application processes the EMR_BEGINPATH record, all previous paths MUST be discarded from the playback device context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_ENDPATH
member.summary: This record closes a path bracket and selects the path defined by the bracket into the playback device context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_CLOSEFIGURE
member.summary: This record closes an open figure in a path.
member.remarks: Processing the EMR_CLOSEFIGURE record MUST close the figure by drawing a line from the current position to the first point of the figure, and then it MUST connect the lines by using the line join style. If a figure is closed by processing the EMR_LINETO record instead of the EMR_CLOSEFIGURE record, end caps are used to create the corner instead of a join. EMR_LINETO is specified in section 2.3.5.13. The EMR_CLOSEFIGURE record SHOULD only be used if there is an open path bracket in the playback device context. A figure in a path is open unless it is explicitly closed by processing this record. Note: A figure can be open even if the current point and the starting point of the figure are the same. After processing the EMR_CLOSEFIGURE record, adding a line or curve to the path MUST start a new figure.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_FILLPATH
member.summary: This record closes any open figures in the current path and fills the path's interior by using the current brush and polygon-filling mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_STROKEANDFILLPATH
member.summary: This record closes any open figures in a path, strokes the outline of the path by using the current pen, and fills its interior by using the current brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_STROKEPATH
member.summary: This record renders the specified path by using the current pen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_FLATTENPATH
member.summary: This record transforms any curve in the path that is selected into the playback device context, turning each curve into a sequence of lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_WIDENPATH
member.summary: This record redefines the current path as the area that would be painted if the path were stroked using the pen currently selected into the playback device context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SELECTCLIPPATH
member.summary: This record defines the current path as a clipping region for the playback device context, combining the new region with any existing clipping region using the specified mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_ABORTPATH
member.summary: This record aborts a path bracket or discards the path from a closed path bracket.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_COMMENT
member.summary: This record specifies arbitrary private data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_FILLRGN
member.summary: This record fills the specified region by using the specified brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_FRAMERGN
member.summary: This record draws a border around the specified region using the specified brush.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_INVERTRGN
member.summary: This record inverts the colors in the specified region.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_PAINTRGN
member.summary: This record paints the specified region by using the brush currently selected into the playback device context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_EXTSELECTCLIPRGN
member.summary: This record combines the specified region with the current clip region using the specified mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_BITBLT
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern, according to a specified raster operation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_STRETCHBLT
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern, according to a specified raster operation, stretching or compressing the output to fit the dimensions of the destination, if necessary.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_MASKBLT
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern and with the application of a color mask bitmap, according to specified foreground and background raster operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_PLGBLT
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination parallelogram, with the application of a color mask bitmap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETDIBITSTODEVICE
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from specified scan lines of a source bitmap to a destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_STRETCHDIBITS
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, optionally in combination with a brush pattern, according to a specified raster operation, stretching or compressing the output to fit the dimensions of the destination, if necessary.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_EXTCREATEFONTINDIRECTW
member.summary: This record defines a logical font that has the specified characteristics. The font can subsequently be selected as the current font for the playback device context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_EXTTEXTOUTA
member.summary: This record draws an ASCII text string using the current font and text colors.Note EMR_EXTTEXTOUTA SHOULD be emulated with an EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW record (section 2.3.5.8). This requires the ASCII text string in the EmrText object to be converted to Unicode UTF16-LE encoding.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW
member.summary: This record draws a Unicode text string using the current font and text colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYBEZIER16
member.summary: This record defines one or more Bezier curves. The curves are drawn using the current pen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYGON16
member.summary: This record defines a polygon consisting of two or more vertexes connected by straight lines. The polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygon is closed automatically by drawing a line from the last vertex to the first.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYLINE16
member.summary: This record defines a series of line segments by connecting the points in the specified array.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYBEZIERTO16
member.summary: This record defines one or more Bezier curves based on the current position.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYLINETO16
member.summary: This record defines one or more straight lines based upon the current position. A line is drawn from the current position to the first point specified by the Points field by using the current pen. For each additional line, drawing is performed from the ending point of the previous line to the next point specified by Points.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYPOLYLINE16
member.summary: This record defines multiple series of connected line segments.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYPOLYGON16
member.summary: This record defines a series of closed polygons. Each polygon is outlined by using the current pen and filled by using the current brush and polygon fill mode. The polygons specified by this record can overlap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYDRAW16
member.summary: This record defines a set of line segments and Bezier curves.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_CREATEMONOBRUSH
member.summary: This record defines a logical brush with the specified bitmap pattern. The bitmap can be a device-independent bitmap (DIB) section bitmap or it can be a device-dependent bitmap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_CREATEDIBPATTERNBRUSHPT
member.summary: This record defines a logical brush that has the pattern specified by the DIB.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_EXTCREATEPEN
member.summary: This record defines a logical cosmetic or geometric pen that has the specified style, width, and brush attributes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYTEXTOUTA
member.summary: This record draws one or more ASCII text strings using the current font and text colors. Note EMR_POLYTEXTOUTA SHOULD be emulated with a series of EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW records, one per string

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_POLYTEXTOUTW
member.summary: This record draws one or more Unicode text strings using the current font and text colors. Note EMR_POLYTEXTOUTW SHOULD be emulated with a series of EMR_EXTTEXTOUTW records, one per string

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETICMMODE
member.summary: This record specifies the mode of Image Color Management (ICM) for graphics operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_CREATECOLORSPACE
member.summary: This record creates a logical color space object from a color profile with a name consisting of ASCII characters

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETCOLORSPACE
member.summary: This record defines the current logical color space object for graphics operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_DELETECOLORSPACE
member.summary: This record deletes a logical color space object. Note An EMR_DELETEOBJECT record SHOULD be used instead of EMR_DELETECOLORSPACE to delete a logical color space object

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_GLSRECORD
member.summary: This record specifies an OpenGL function.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_GLSBOUNDEDRECORD
member.summary: This record specifies an OpenGL function with a bounding rectangle for output.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_PIXELFORMAT
member.summary: This record specifies the pixel format to use for graphics operations

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_DRAWESCAPE
member.summary: This record passes arbitrary information to the driver. The intent is that the information will result in drawing being done.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_EXTESCAPE
member.summary: This record passes arbitrary information to the driver. The intent is that the information will not result in drawing being done.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SMALLTEXTOUT
member.summary: This record outputs a string.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_FORCEUFIMAPPING
member.summary: This record forces the font mapper to match fonts based on their UniversalFontId in preference to their LogFont information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_NAMEDESCAPE
member.summary: This record passes arbitrary information to the given named driver.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_COLORCORRECTPALETTE
member.summary: This record specifies how to correct the entries of a logical palette object using Windows Color System (WCS) 1.0 values

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETICMPROFILEA
member.summary: This record specifies a color profile in a file with a name consisting of ASCII characters, for graphics output.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETICMPROFILEW
member.summary: This record specifies a color profile in a file with a name consisting of Unicode characters, for graphics output

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_ALPHABLEND
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, including alpha transparency data, according to a specified blending operation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETLAYOUT
member.summary: This record specifies the order in which text and graphics are drawn

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_TRANSPARENTBLT
member.summary: This record specifies a block transfer of pixels from a source bitmap to a destination rectangle, treating a specified color as transparent, stretching or compressing the output to fit the dimensions of the destination, if necessary

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_GRADIENTFILL
member.summary: This record specifies filling rectangles or triangles with gradients of color

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETLINKEDUFIS
member.summary: This record sets the UniversalFontIds of linked fonts to use during character lookup.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_SETTEXTJUSTIFICATION
member.summary: This record specifies the amount of extra space to add to break characters for justification purposes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_COLORMATCHTOTARGETW
member.summary: This record specifies whether to perform color matching with a color profile that is specified in a file with a name consisting of Unicode characters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRecordType.EMR_CREATECOLORSPACEW
member.summary: This record creates a logical color space object from a color profile with a name consisting of Unicode characters

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRegionMode
member.summary: The RegionMode enumeration defines values that are used with EMR_SELECTCLIPPATH and EMR_EXTSELECTCLIPRGN, specifying the current path or a new region that is being combined with the current clip region.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRegionMode.RGN_AND
member.summary: The new clipping region includes the intersection (overlapping areas) of the current clipping region and the current path (or new region).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRegionMode.RGN_OR
member.summary: The new clipping region includes the union (combined areas) of the current clipping region and the current path (or new region).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRegionMode.RGN_XOR
member.summary: The new clipping region includes the union of the current clipping region and the current path (or new region) but without the overlapping areas

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRegionMode.RGN_DIFF
member.summary: The new clipping region includes the areas of the current clipping region with those of the current path (or new region) excluded.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfRegionMode.RGN_COPY
member.summary: The new clipping region is the current path (or the new region).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject
member.summary: The StockObject enumeration specifies the indexes of predefined logical graphics objects that can be used in graphics operations.The specific structures of stock objects are implementation-dependent; however, the properties of stock objects SHOULD be equivalent to the properties of explicitly created objects of the same type. These properties are specified where possible for the stock objects defined in this enumeration.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.WHITE_BRUSH
member.summary: A white, solid-color brush that is equivalent to a logical brush (LogBrushEx object, section 2.2.12) with the following properties: BrushStyle: BS_SOLID (WMF BrushStyle enumeration, [MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.4) Color: 0x00FFFFFF (WMF ColorRef object, [MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.8)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.LTGRAY_BRUSH
member.summary: A light gray, solid-color brush that is equivalent to a logical brush with the following properties: BrushStyle: BS_SOLID Color: 0x00C0C0C0

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.GRAY_BRUSH
member.summary: A gray, solid-color brush that is equivalent to a logical brush with the following properties: BrushStyle: BS_SOLID Color: 0x00808080

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.DKGRAY_BRUSH
member.summary: A dark gray, solid color brush that is equivalent to a logical brush with the following properties: BrushStyle: BS_SOLID Color: 0x00404040

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.BLACK_BRUSH
member.summary: A black, solid color brush that is equivalent to a logical brush with the following properties: BrushStyle: BS_SOLID Color: 0x00000000

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.NULL_BRUSH
member.summary: A null brush that is equivalent to a logical brush with the following properties: BrushStyle: BS_NULL

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.WHITE_PEN
member.summary: A white, solid-color pen that is equivalent to a logical pen (LogPen object, section 2.2.19) with the following properties: PenStyle: PS_COSMETIC + PS_SOLID (PenStyle enumeration, section 2.1.25) ColorRef: 0x00FFFFFF (WMF ColorRef object).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.BLACK_PEN
member.summary: A black, solid-color pen that is equivalent to a logical pen with the following properties: PenStyle: PS_COSMETIC + PS_SOLID ColorRef: 0x00000000

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.NULL_PEN
member.summary: A null pen that is equivalent to a logical pen with the following properties: PenStyle: PS_NULL

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.OEM_FIXED_FONT
member.summary: A fixed-width, OEM character set font that is equivalent to a logical font (LogFont object, section 2.2.13) with the following properties: Charset: OEM_CHARSET (WMF CharacterSet enumeration, [MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.5) PitchAndFamily: FF_DONTCARE (WMF FamilyFont enumeration, [MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.8) + FIXED_PITCH (WMF PitchFont enumeration, [MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.24)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.ANSI_FIXED_FONT
member.summary: A fixed-width font that is equivalent to a logical font with the following properties: Charset: ANSI_CHARSET PitchAndFamily: FF_DONTCARE + FIXED_PITCH

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.ANSI_VAR_FONT
member.summary: A variable-width font that is equivalent to a logical font with the following properties: Charset: ANSI_CHARSET PitchAndFamily: FF_DONTCARE + VARIABLE_PITCH

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.SYSTEM_FONT
member.summary: A font that is guaranteed to be available in the operating system. The actual font that is specified by this value is implementation-dependent

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.DEVICE_DEFAULT_FONT
member.summary: The default font that is provided by the graphics device driver for the current output device. The actual font that is specified by this value is implementation-dependent

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.DEFAULT_PALETTE
member.summary: The default palette that is defined for the current output device. The actual palette that is specified by this value is implementation-dependent

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.SYSTEM_FIXED_FONT
member.summary: A fixed-width font that is guaranteed to be available in the operating system. The actual font that is specified by this value is implementation-dependent

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.DEFAULT_GUI_FONT
member.summary: A fixed-width font that is guaranteed to be available in the operating system. The actual font that is specified by this value is implementation-dependent

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.DC_BRUSH
member.summary: The solid-color brush that is currently selected in the playback device context

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStockObject.DC_PEN
member.summary: The solid-color pen that is currently selected in the playback device context

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStretchMode
member.summary: The StretchMode enumeration is used to specify how color data is added to or removed from bitmaps that are stretched or compressed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStretchMode.STRETCH_ANDSCANS
member.summary: Performs a Boolean AND operation using the color values for the eliminated and existing pixels. If the bitmap is a monochrome bitmap, this mode preserves black pixels at the expense of white pixels

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStretchMode.STRETCH_ORSCANS
member.summary: Performs a Boolean OR operation using the color values for the eliminated and existing pixels. If the bitmap is a monochrome bitmap, this mode preserves white pixels at the expense of black pixels.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStretchMode.STRETCH_DELETESCANS
member.summary: Deletes the pixels. This mode deletes all eliminated lines of pixels without trying to preserve their information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStretchMode.STRETCH_HALFTONE
member.summary: Maps pixels from the source rectangle into blocks of pixels in the destination rectangle. The average color over the destination block of pixels approximates the color of the source pixels.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStrokeVariation
member.summary: The StrokeVariation enumeration defines values for one of the characteristics in the PANOSE system for classifying typefaces.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStrokeVariation.PAN_ANY
member.summary: The Any Stroke.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStrokeVariation.PAN_NO_FIT
member.summary: The No fit.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStrokeVariation.PAN_STROKE_GRADUAL_DIAG
member.summary: Gradual / diagonal

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStrokeVariation.PAN_STROKE_GRADUAL_TRAN
member.summary: Gradual transitional

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStrokeVariation.PAN_STROKE_GRADUAL_VERT
member.summary: Gradual vertical

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStrokeVariation.PAN_STROKE_GRADUAL_HORZ
member.summary: Gradual horizontal

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Consts.EmfStrokeVariation.PAN_STROKE_RAPID_VERT
member.summary: Rapid vertical

member.summary: The BitFIX28_4 object defines a numeric value in 28.4 bit FIX notation.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfBitFix28To4.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfBitFix28To4.IntVal
member.summary: Gets or sets the integer value value

member.summary: Gets or sets the fraction value

member.summary: Gets the resulting float value;

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment
member.summary: The ColorAdjustment object defines values for adjusting the colors in source bitmaps in bit-block transfers.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size in bytes of this object. This MUST be 0x0018.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.Values
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies how to prepare the output image. This field can be set to NULL or to any combination of values in the ColorAdjustment enumeration (section 2.1.5).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.IlluminantIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the type of standard light source under which the image is viewed, from the Illuminant enumeration (section 2.1.19).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.RedGamma
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the nth power gamma correction value for the red primary of the source colors. This value SHOULD be in the range from 2,500 to 65,000. A value of 10,000 means gamma correction MUST NOT be performed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.GreenGamma
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the nth power gamma correction value for the green primary of the source colors. This value SHOULD be in the range from 2,500 to 65,000. A value of 10,000 means gamma correction MUST NOT be performed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.BlueGamma
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the nth power gamma correction value for the blue primary of the source colors. This value SHOULD be in the range from 2,500 to 65,000. A value of 10,000 means gamma correction MUST NOT be performed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.ReferenceBlack
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the black reference for the source colors. Any colors that are darker than this are treated as black. This value SHOULD be in the range from zero to 4,000

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.ReferenceWhite
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the white reference for the source colors. Any colors that are lighter than this are treated as white. This value SHOULD be in the range from 6,000 to 10,000.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.Contrast
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit signed integer that specifies the amount of contrast to be applied to the source object. This value SHOULD be in the range from –100 to 100. A value of zero means contrast adjustment MUST NOT be performed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.Brightness
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit signed integer that specifies the amount of brightness to be applied to the source object. This value SHOULD be in the range from –100 to 100. A value of zero means brightness adjustment MUST NOT be performed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.Colorfullness
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit signed integer that specifies the amount of colorfulness to be applied to the source object. This value SHOULD be in the range from –100 to 100. A value of zero means colorfulness adjustment MUST NOT be performed

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfColorAdjustment.RedGreenTint
member.summary: Gets or sets 16-bit signed integer that specifies the amount of red or green tint adjustment to be applied to the source object. This value SHOULD be in the range from –100 to 100. Positive numbers adjust towards red and negative numbers adjust towards green. A value of zero means tint adjustment MUST NOT be performed

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfDesignVector
member.summary: The DesignVector (section 2.2.3) object defines the design vector, which specifies values for the font axes of a multiple master font.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfDesignVector.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that MUST be set to the value 0x08007664.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfDesignVector.NumAxes
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of elements in the Values array. It MUST be in the range 0 to 16, inclusive

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfDesignVector.Values
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional array of 32-bit signed integers that specify the values of the font axes of a multiple master, OpenType font. The maximum number of values in the array is 16.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfEpsData
member.summary: The EpsData object is a container for EPS data

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfEpsData.SizeData
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the total size of this object, in bytes

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfEpsData.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the PostScript language level. This value MUST be 0x00000001

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfEpsData.Points
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of three Point28_4 objects (section 2.2.23) that defines the coordinates of the output parallelogram using 28.4 bit FIX notation
member.remarks: The upper-left corner of the parallelogram is the first point in this array, the upper-right corner is the second point, and the lower-left corner is the third point. The lower-right corner of the parallelogram is computed from the first three points (A, B, and C) by treating them as vectors.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfEpsData.PostScriptData
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of bytes of PostScript data. The length of this array can be computed from the SizeData field. This data MAY be used to render an image.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfFormat
member.summary: The EmrFormat object contains information that identifies the format of image data in an EMR_COMMENT_MULTIFORMATS record(section 2.3.3.4.3).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfFormat.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the format of the image data. This value MUST be in the FormatSignature enumeration (section 2.1.14).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfFormat.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the format version number. If the Signature field specifies encapsulated PostScript (EPS), this value MUST be 0x00000001; otherwise, this value MUST be ignored

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfFormat.SizeData
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size of the data in bytes

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfFormat.OffData
member.summary: Gets or sets 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset to the data from the start of the identifier field in an EMR_COMMENT_PUBLIC record (section 2.3.3.4). The offset MUST be 32-bit aligned.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfGradientRectangle
member.summary: The GradientRectangle object defines a rectangle using TriVertex objects (section 2.2.26) in an EMR_GRADIENTFILL record (section 2.3.5.12).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfGradientRectangle.UpperLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets an index into an array of TriVertex objects that specifies the upper-left vertex of a rectangle. The index MUST be smaller than the size of the array, as defined by the nVer field of the EMR_GRADIENTFILL record.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfGradientRectangle.LowerRight
member.summary: Gets or sets an index into an array of TriVertex objects that specifies the lower-right vertex of a rectangle. The index MUST be smaller than the size of the array, as defined by the nVer field of the EMR_GRADIENTFILL record.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfGradientTriangle
member.summary: The GradientTriangle object defines a triangle using TriVertex objects (section 2.2.26) in an EMR_GRADIENTFILL record (section 2.3.5.12)

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfGradientTriangle.Vertex1
member.summary: Gets or sets an index into an array of TriVertex objects that specifies a vertex of a triangle. The index MUST be smaller than the size of the array, as defined by the nVer field of the EMR_GRADIENTFILL record.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfGradientTriangle.Vertex2
member.summary: Gets or sets an index into an array of TriVertex objects that specifies a vertex of a triangle. The index MUST be smaller than the size of the array, as defined by the nVer field of the EMR_GRADIENTFILL record.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfGradientTriangle.Vertex3
member.summary: Gets or sets an index into an array of TriVertex objects that specifies a vertex of a triangle. The index MUST be smaller than the size of the array, as defined by the nVer field of the EMR_GRADIENTFILL record.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderExtension1
member.summary: The HeaderExtension1 object defines the first extension to the EMF metafile header. It adds support for a PixelFormatDescriptor object (section 2.2.22) and OpenGL [OPENGL] records (section 2.3.9).

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject
member.summary: The Header object defines the EMF metafile header. It specifies properties of the device on which the image in the metafile was created.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF RectL object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.19) that specifies the rectangular inclusive-inclusive bounds in device units of the smallest rectangle that can be drawn around the image stored in the metafile

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Frame
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF RectL object that specifies the rectangular inclusive-inclusive dimensions, in .01 millimeter units, of a rectangle that surrounds the image stored in the metafile

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.RecordSignature
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the record signature. This MUST be ENHMETA_SIGNATURE, from the FormatSignature enumeration (section 2.1.14).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets Version (4 bytes): A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies EMF metafile interoperability. This SHOULD be 0x00010000

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Bytes
member.summary: Gets or sets 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size of the metafile, in bytes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Records
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of records in the metafile

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Handles
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of graphics objects that will be used during the processing of the metafile

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Reserved
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that MUST be 0x0000 and MUST be ignored

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.NDesription
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of characters in the array that contains the description of the metafile's contents. This is zero if there is no description string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.OffDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset from the beginning of this record to the array that contains the description of the metafile's contents

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.NPalEntries
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of entries in the metafile palette. The palette is located in the EMR_EOF record

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Device
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF SizeL object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.22) that specifies the size of the reference device, in pixels

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Millimeters
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF SizeL object that specifies the size of the reference device, in millimeters

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderObject.Valid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is valid.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderExtension1.CbPixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size of the PixelFormatDescriptor object. This MUST be 0x00000000 if no pixel format is set

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderExtension1.OffPixelFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the offset to the PixelFormatDescriptor object. This MUST be 0x00000000 if no pixel format is set.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderExtension1.BOpenGl
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that indicates whether OpenGL commands are present in the metafile. 0x00000000 OpenGL records are not present in the metafile. 0x00000001 OpenGL records are present in the metafile.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderExtension2
member.summary: The HeaderExtension2 object defines the second extension to the EMF metafile header. It adds the ability to measure device surfaces in micrometers, which enhances the resolution and scalability of EMF metafiles.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderExtension2.MicrometersX
member.summary: Gets or sets the 32-bit horizontal size of the display device for which the metafile image was generated, in micrometers

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfHeaderExtension2.MicrometersY
member.summary: Gets or sets the 32-bit vertical size of the display device for which the metafile image was generated, in micrometers.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogBrushEx
member.summary: The LogBrushEx object defines the style, color, and pattern of a device-independent brush.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogBrushEx.BrushStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the brush style. The value MUST be an enumeration from WMF BrushStyle enumeration ([MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.4). The style values that are supported in this structure are listed later in this section. The BS_NULL style SHOULD be used to specify a brush that has no effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogBrushEx.Argb32ColorRef
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit WMF ColorRef object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.8) that specifies a color. The interpretation of this field depends on the value of BrushStyle, as explained in the following table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogBrushEx.BrushHatch
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned field that contains the brush hatch data. Its interpretation depends on the value of BrushStyle,

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont
member.summary: The LogFont object specifies the basic attributes of a logical font.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the height, in logical units, of the font's character cell or character. The character height value, also known as the em size, is the character cell height value minus the internal leading value. The font mapper SHOULD interpret the value specified in the Height field in the following manner.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the average width, in logical units, of characters in the font. If the Width field value is zero, an appropriate value SHOULD be calculated from other LogFont values to find a font that has the typographer's intended aspect ratio

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Escapement
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between the escapement vector and the x-axis of the device. The escapement vector is parallel to the baseline of a row of text.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between each character's baseline and the x-axis of the device.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Weight
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the weight of the font in the range zero through 1000. For example, 400 is normal and 700 is bold. If this value is zero, a default weight can be used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Italic
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies an italic font if set to 0x01; otherwise, it MUST be set to 0x00.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Underline
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies an underlined font if set to 0x01; otherwise, it MUST be set to 0x00.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Strikeout
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies a strikeout font if set to 0x01; otherwise, it MUST be set to 0x00.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.CharSet
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the set of character glyphs. It MUST be a value in the WMF CharacterSet enumeration ([MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.5). If the character set is unknown, metafile processing SHOULD NOT attempt to translate or interpret strings that are rendered with that font.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.OutPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the output precision. The output precision defines how closely the font is required to match the requested height, width, character orientation, escapement, pitch, and font type. It MUST be a value from the WMF OutPrecision enumeration

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.ClipPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the clipping precision. The clipping precision defines how to clip characters that are partially outside the clipping region. It can be one or more of the WMF ClipPrecision Flags

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Quality
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the output quality. The output quality defines how closely to attempt to match the logical-font attributes to those of an actual physical font. It MUST be one of the values in the WMF FontQuality enumeration ([MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.10).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.PitchAndFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF PitchAndFamily object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.14) that specifies the pitch and family of the font. Font families describe the look of a font in a general way. They are intended for specifying a font when the specified typeface is not available.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont.Facename
member.summary: Gets or sets a Facename (64 bytes): A string of no more than 32 Unicode characters that specifies the typeface name of the font. If the length of this string is less than 32 characters, a terminating NULL MUST be present, after which the remainder of this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFontEx
member.summary: The LogFontEx object specifies the extended attributes of a logical font.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFontEx.#ctor(Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFont)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFontEx.FullName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string of 64 Unicode characters that contains the font's full name. If the length of this string is less than 64 characters, a terminating NULL MUST be present, after which the remainder of this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFontEx.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets a string of 32 Unicode characters that defines the font's style. If the length of this string is less than 32 characters, a terminating NULL MUST be present, after which the remainder of this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFontEx.Script
member.summary: Gets or sets a string of 32 Unicode characters that defines the character set of the font. If the length of this string is less than 32 characters, a terminating NULL MUST be present, after which the remainder of this field MUST be ignored.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string of 32 Unicode characters that defines the font's style. If the length of this string is less than 32 characters, a terminating NULL MUST be present, after which the remainder of this field MUST be ignored.

member.summary: Gets or sets This field MUST be ignored.

member.summary: Gets or sets This field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogFontPanose.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets a field that exists only to ensure 32-bit alignment of this structure. It MUST be ignored

member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the version number of the system. This MUST be 0x0300.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPalette.PaletteArgb32Entries
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of 32-bit ARGB colors.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPen
member.summary: The LogPen object defines the style, width, and color of a logical pen.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPen.PenStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the PenStyle. The value MUST be defined from the PenStyle enumeration table, specified in section 2.1.25.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPen.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF PointL object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.15) that specifies the width of the pen by the value of its x field. The value of its y field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPen.AffectWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the affect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPen.Argb32ColorRef
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF ColorRef object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.8) that specifies the pen color value.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPenEx
member.summary: The LogPenEx object specifies the style, width, and color of an extended logical pen.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPenEx.PenStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the pen style

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPenEx.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the width of the line drawn by the pen. If the pen type in the PenStyle field is PS_GEOMETRIC, this value is the width in logical units; otherwise, the width is specified in device units. If the pen type in the PenStyle field is PS_COSMETIC, this value MUST be 0x00000001.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPenEx.BrushStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies a brush style for the pen from the WMF BrushStyle enumeration ([MS-WMF] section 2.1.1.4). If the pen type in the PenStyle field is PS_GEOMETRIC, this value MUST be either BS_SOLID or BS_HATCHED. The value of this field can be BS_NULL, but only if the line style specified in PenStyle is PS_NULL. The BS_NULL style SHOULD be used to specify a brush that has no effect.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPenEx.Argb32ColorRef
member.summary: Gets or sets a WMF ColorRef object ([MS-WMF] section 2.2.2.8). The interpretation of this field depends on the BrushStyle value, as shown in the table later in this section.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPenEx.BrushHatch
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush hatch pattern. The definition of this field depends on the BrushStyle value, as shown in the table later in this section.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPenEx.NumStyleEntities
member.summary: Gets the number of elements in the array specified in the StyleEntry field. This value SHOULD be zero if PenStyle does not specify PS_USERSTYLE.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPenEx.StyleEntry
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional array of 32-bit unsigned integers that defines the lengths of dashes and gaps in the line drawn by this pen, when the value of PenStyle is PS_USERSTYLE line style for the pen. The array contains a number of entries specified by NumStyleEntries, but it is used as if it repeated indefinitely The first entry in the array specifies the length of the first dash. The second entry specifies the length of the first gap. Thereafter, lengths of dashes and gaps alternate. If the pen type in the PenStyle field is PS_GEOMETRIC, the lengths are specified in logical units; otherwise, the lengths are specified in device units.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfLogPenEx.BrushDibPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush dib pattern.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose
member.summary: The Panose object describes the PANOSE font-classification values for a TrueType font. These characteristics are used to associate the font with other fonts of similar appearance but different names.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.FamilyType
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the family type. The value MUST be in the FamilyType (section 2.1.12) enumeration table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.SerifStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the serif style. The value MUST be in the SerifType (section 2.1.30) enumeration table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.Weight
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the weight of the font. The value MUST be in the Weight (section 2.1.34) enumeration table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.Proportion
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the proportion of the font. The value MUST be in the Proportion (section 2.1.28) enumeration table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.Contrast
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the contrast of the font. The value MUST be in the Contrast (section 2.1.8) enumeration table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.StrokeVariation
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the stroke variation for the font. The value MUST be in the StrokeVariation (section 2.1.33) enumeration table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.ArmStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the arm style of the font. The value MUST be in the ArmStyle (section 2.1.3) enumeration table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.Letterform
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the letterform of the font. The value MUST be in the Letterform (section 2.1.20) enumeration table

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.Midline
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the midline of the font. The value MUST be in the MidLine (section 2.1.23) enumeration table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPanose.XHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets an 8-bit unsigned integer that specifies the x height of the font. The value MUST be in the XHeight (section 2.1.35) enumeration table.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor
member.summary: The PixelFormatDescriptor object can be used in EMR_HEADER records (section 2.3.4.2) to specify the pixel format of the output surface for the playback device context.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.NSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of this data structure.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.NVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit integer that MUST be set to 0x0001.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.DwFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets bit flags that specify properties of the pixel buffer that is used for output to the drawing surface. These properties are not all mutually exclusive; combinations of flags are allowed, except where noted otherwise.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.IPixelType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of pixel data PFD_TYPE_RGBA 0x00 The pixel format is RGBA. PFD_TYPE_COLORINDEX 0x01 Each pixel is an index in a color table.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.CColorBits
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of bits per pixel for RGBA pixel types, excluding the alpha bitplanes. For color table pixels, it is the size of each color table index

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.CRedBits
member.summary: Gets or sets Specifies the number of red bitplanes in each RGBA color buffer

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.CRedShift
member.summary: Gets or sets Specifies the shift count in bits for red bitplanes in each RGBA color buffer.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.CGreenBits
member.summary: Gets or sets Specifies the number of green bitplanes in each RGBA color buffer

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.CGreenShift
member.summary: Gets or sets Specifies the shift count for green bitplanes in each RGBA color buffer.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.CBlueBits

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.CBlueShift

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Emf.Emf.Objects.EmfPixelFormatDescriptor.CAlphaBits
