member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains types [MS-WMF]: Windows Metafile Format 2.1 WMF Constants

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.StretchMode
member.summary: The Enumeration specifies the bitmap stretching mode, which defines how the system combines rows or columns of a bitmap with existing pixels.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.StretchMode.BlackOnWhite
member.summary: Performs a Boolean AND operation by using the color values for the eliminated and existing pixels. If the bitmap is a monochrome bitmap, this mode preserves black pixels at the expense of white pixels

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.StretchMode.WhiteOnBlack
member.summary: Performs a Boolean OR operation by using the color values for the eliminated and existing pixels. If the bitmap is a monochrome bitmap, this mode preserves white pixels at the expense of black pixels

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.StretchMode.ColorOnColor
member.summary: Deletes the pixels. This mode deletes all eliminated lines of pixels without trying to preserve their information.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.StretchMode.HalfTone
member.summary: Maps pixels from the source rectangle into blocks of pixels in the destination rectangle. The average color over the destination block of pixels approximates the color of the source pixels.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation
member.summary: The BinaryRasterOperation Enumeration section lists the binary raster-operation codes. Raster operation codes define how metafile processing combines the bits from the selected pen with the bits in the destination bitmap.
member.remarks: Each raster-operation code represents a Boolean operation in which the values of the pixels in the selected pen and the destination bitmap are combined. Following are the two operands used in these operations. Operand Meaning P Selected pen D Destination bitmap a Bitwise AND n Bitwise NOT (inverse) o Bitwise OR x Bitwise exclusive OR (XOR)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Black
member.summary: 0, Pixel is always 0.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Notmergepen
member.summary: DPon, Pixel is the inverse of the MERGEPEN color

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Masknotpen
member.summary: DPna, Pixel is a combination of the screen color and the inverse of the pen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Notcopypen
member.summary: Pn, Pixel is the inverse of the pen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Maskpennot
member.summary: PDna, Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the inverse of the screen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Not
member.summary: Dn, Pixel is the inverse of the screen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Xorpen
member.summary: DPx, Pixel is a combination of the colors in the pen or in the screen, but not in both.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Notmaskpen
member.summary: DPan, Pixel is the inverse of the MASKPEN color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Maskpen
member.summary: DPa, Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the screen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Notxorpen
member.summary: DPxn, Pixel is the inverse of the XORPEN color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Nop
member.summary: D, Pixel remains unchanged.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Mergenotpen
member.summary: DPno, Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the screen and the inverse of the pen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Copypen
member.summary: P, Pixel is the pen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Mergepennot
member.summary: PDno, Pixel is a combination of the pen color and the inverse of the screen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.Mergepen
member.summary: DPo, Pixel is a combination of the pen color and the screen color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBinaryRasterOperation.White
member.summary: 1, Pixel is always 1

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount
member.summary: The BitCount Enumeration specifies the number of bits that define each pixel and the maximum number of colors in a device-independent bitmap (DIB).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_0
member.summary: The number of bits per pixel is undefined. The image SHOULD be in either JPEG or PNG format. Neither of these formats includes a color table, so this value specifies that no color table is present. See [JFIF] and [RFC2083] for more information concerning JPEG and PNG compression formats.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_1
member.summary: The image is specified with two colors.Each pixel in the bitmap is represented by a single bit. If the bit is clear, the pixel is displayed with the color of the first entry in the color table; if the bit is set, the pixel has the color of the second entry in the table.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_2
member.summary: The image is specified with a maximum of 16 colors. Each pixel in the bitmap is represented by a 4-bit index into the color table, and each byte contains 2 pixels.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_3
member.summary: The image is specified with a maximum of 256 colors. Each pixel in the bitmap is represented by an 8-bit index into the color table, and each byte contains 1 pixel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_4
member.summary: The image is specified with a maximum of 2^16 colors. Each pixel in the bitmap is represented by a 16-bit value

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_5
member.summary: The bitmap has a maximum of 2^24 colors, and the Colors field of DIB is NULL. Each 3-byte triplet in the bitmap array represents the relative intensities of blue, green, and red, respectively, for a pixel. The Colors color table is used for optimizing colors used on palette-based devices, and MUST contain the number of entries specified by the ColorUsed field of the BitmapInfoHeader Object

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBitCount.BI_BITCOUNT_6
member.summary: The bitmap has a maximum of 2^24 colors

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle
member.summary: The BrushStyle Enumeration specifies the different possible brush types that can be used in graphics operations. For more information, see the specification of the Brush Object (section 2.2.1.1).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Solid
member.summary: A brush that paints a single, constant color, either solid or dithered.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Null
member.summary: A brush that does nothing. Using a NULL brush in a graphics operation MUST have the same effect as using no brush at all

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Hatched
member.summary: A brush that paints a predefined simple pattern, or "hatch", onto a solid background

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Pattern
member.summary: A brush that paints a pattern defined by a bitmap, which MAY be a Bitmap16 Object or a DeviceIndependentBitmap (DIB) Object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Indexed
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Dibpattern
member.summary: A pattern brush specified by a DIB.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Dibpatternpt
member.summary: A pattern brush specified by a DIB.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Pattern8X8
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Dibpattern8X8
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Monopattern
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfBrushStyle.Gradient
member.summary: The gradient Not suppoted in wmf, support in odg.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet
member.summary: The CharacterSet Enumeration defines the possible sets of character glyphs that are defined in fonts for graphics output.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Ansi
member.summary: Specifies the English character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Default
member.summary: Specifies a character set based on the current system locale; for example, when the system locale is United States English, the default character set is ANSI_CHARSET.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Symbol
member.summary: Specifies a character set of symbols.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Mac
member.summary: Specifies the Apple Macintosh character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Shiftjis
member.summary: Specifies the Japanese character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Hangul
member.summary: Also spelled "Hangeul". Specifies the Hangul Korean character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Johab
member.summary: Also spelled "Johap". Specifies the Johab Korean character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Gb2312
member.summary: Specifies the "simplified" Chinese character set for People's Republic of China.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Chinesebig5
member.summary: Specifies the "traditional" Chinese character set, used mostly in Taiwan and in the Hong Kong and Macao Special Administrative Regions.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Greek
member.summary: Specifies the Greek character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Turkish
member.summary: Specifies the Turkish character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Vietnamese
member.summary: Specifies the Vietnamese character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Hebrew
member.summary: Specifies the Vietnamese character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Arabic
member.summary: Specifies the Arabic character set

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Baltic
member.summary: Specifies the Baltic (Northeastern European) character set

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Russian
member.summary: Specifies the Russian Cyrillic character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Thai
member.summary: Specifies the Thai character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Easteurope
member.summary: Specifies a Eastern European character set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCharacterSet.Oem
member.summary: Specifies a mapping to one of the OEM code pages, according to the current system locale setting.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags
member.summary: ClipPrecision Flags specify clipping precision, which defines how to clip characters that are partially outside a clipping region. These flags can be combined to specify multiple options.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.Default
member.summary: Specifies that default clipping MUST be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.Character
member.summary: This value SHOULD NOT be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.Stroke
member.summary: This value MAY be returned when enumerating rasterized, TrueType and vector fonts. [33] (Windows NT 3.1, Windows NT 3.5, Windows NT 3.51, Windows NT 4.0, Windows 2000, and Windows XP: This value is always returned when enumerating fonts.)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.LhAngles
member.summary: This value is used to control font rotation, as follows: - If set, the rotation for all fonts SHOULD be determined by the orientation of the coordinate system; that is, whether the orientation is left-handed or right-handed. - If clear, device fonts SHOULD rotate counterclockwise, but the rotation of other fonts SHOULD be determined by the orientation of the coordinate system.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.TtAlways
member.summary: This value SHOULD NOT [34] be used. [34] This value is ignored in the following Windows versions: - Windows Vista - Windows Server 2008 - Windows 7 - Windows Server 2008 R2 - Windows 8 - Windows Server 2012 - Windows 8.1 - Windows Server 2012 R2

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.DfaDisable
member.summary: This value specifies that font association SHOULD [35] be turned off. [35] This value is not supported.in Windows 95, Windows 98, and Windows Millennium Edition. Font association is turned off in Windows 2000, Windows XP, and Windows Server 2003. This value is ignored in these Windows versions: - Windows Vista - Windows Server 2008 - Windows 7 - Windows Server 2008 R2 - Windows 8 - Windows Server 2012 - Windows 8.1 - Windows Server 2012 R2

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfClipPrecisionFlags.Embedded
member.summary: This value specifies that font embedding MUST be used to render document content; embedded fonts are read-only.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfColorUsageEnum
member.summary: The ColorUsage Enumeration specifies whether a color table exists in a device-independent bitmap(DIB) and how to interpret its values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfColorUsageEnum.DIB_RGB_COLORS
member.summary: The color table contains RGB values specified by RGBQuad Objects (section 2.2.2.20).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfColorUsageEnum.DIB_PAL_COLORS
member.summary: The color table contains 16-bit indices into the current logical palette in the playback device context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfColorUsageEnum.DIB_PAL_INDICES
member.summary: No color table exists. The pixels in the DIB are indices into the current logical palette in the playback device context.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression
member.summary: The Compression Enumeration specifies the type of compression for a bitmap image

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_RGB
member.summary: The bitmap is in uncompressed red green blue (RGB) format that is not compressed and does not use color masks.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_RLE8
member.summary: An RGB format that uses run-length encoding (RLE) compression for bitmaps with 8 bits per pixel. The compression uses a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by a byte containing a color index.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_RLE4
member.summary: An RGB format that uses RLE compression for bitmaps with 4 bits per pixel. The compression uses a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by two word-length color indexes

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_BITFIELDS
member.summary: The bitmap is not compressed and the color table consists of three DWORD color masks that specify the red, green, and blue components, respectively, of each pixel. This is valid when used with 16 and 32-bits per pixel bitmaps.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_JPEG
member.summary: The image is a JPEG image, as specified in [JFIF]. This value SHOULD only be used in certain bitmap operations, such as JPEG pass-through. The application MUST query for the pass-through support, since not all devices support JPEG pass-through. Using non-RGB bitmaps MAY limit the portability of the metafile to other devices. For instance, display device contexts generally do not support this pass-through

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_PNG
member.summary: The image is a PNG image, as specified in [RFC2083]. This value SHOULD only be used certain bitmap operations, such as JPEG/PNG pass-through. The application MUST query for the pass-through support, because not all devices support JPEG/PNG pass-through. Using non-RGB bitmaps MAY limit the portability of the metafile to other devices. For instance, display device contexts generally do not support this pass-through.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_CMYK
member.summary: The image is an uncompressed CMYK format.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_CMYKRLE8
member.summary: A CMYK format that uses RLE compression for bitmaps with 8 bits per pixel. The compression uses a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by a byte containing a color index.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfCompression.BI_CMYKRLE4
member.summary: A CMYK format that uses RLE compression for bitmaps with 4 bits per pixel. The compression uses a 2-byte format consisting of a count byte followed by two word-length color indexes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont
member.summary: The FamilyFont enumeration specifies the font family. Font families describe the look of a font in a general way. They are intended for specifying fonts when the exact typeface desired is not available.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.Dontcare
member.summary: The default font is specified, which is implementation-dependent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.Roman
member.summary: Fonts with variable stroke widths, which are proportional to the actual widths of the glyphs, and which have serifs. "MS Serif" is an example.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.Swiss
member.summary: Fonts with variable stroke widths, which are proportional to the actual widths of the glyphs, and which do not have serifs. "MS Sans Serif" is an example.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.Modern
member.summary: Fonts with constant stroke width, with or without serifs. Fixed-width fonts are usually modern. "Pica", "Elite", and "Courier New" are examples.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.Script
member.summary: Fonts designed to look like handwriting. "Script" and "Cursive" are examples.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFamilyFont.Decorative
member.summary: Novelty fonts. "Old English" is an example.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFloodFillMode
member.summary: The FloodFill Enumeration specifies the type of fill operation to be performed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFloodFillMode.FloodFillBorder
member.summary: The fill area is bounded by the color specified by the Color member. This style is identical to the filling performed by the META_FLOODFILL record.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFloodFillMode.FloodFillSurface
member.summary: The fill area is bounded by the color that is specified by the Color member. Filling continues outward in all directions as long as the color is encountered. This style is useful for filling areas with multicolored boundaries.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality
member.summary: The FontQuality Enumeration specifies how closely the attributes of the logical font should match those of the physical font when rendering text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.Default
member.summary: Specifies that the character quality of the font does not matter, so DRAFT can be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.Draft
member.summary: Specifies that the character quality of the font is less important than the matching of logical attribuetes. For rasterized fonts, scaling SHOULD be enabled, which means that more font sizes are available.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.Proof
member.summary: Specifies that the character quality of the font is more important than the matching of logical attributes. For rasterized fonts, scaling SHOULD be disabled, and the font closest in size SHOULD be chosen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.Nonantialiased
member.summary: Specifies that anti-aliasing SHOULD NOT be used when rendering text

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.Antialiased
member.summary: Specifies that anti-aliasing SHOULD be used when rendering text, if the font supports it.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfFontQuality.Cleartype
member.summary: Specifies that ClearType anti-aliasing SHOULD be used when rendering text, if the font supports it.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfGamutMappingIntent
member.summary: The GamutMappingIntent Enumeration specifies the relationship between logical and physical colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfGamutMappingIntent.LCS_GM_ABS_COLORIMETRIC
member.summary: Specifies that the white point SHOULD be maintained. Typically used when logical colors MUST be matched to their nearest physical color in the destination color gamut. Intent: Match ICC name: Absolute Colorimetric

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfGamutMappingIntent.LCS_GM_BUSINESS
member.summary: Specifies that saturation SHOULD be maintained. Typically used for business charts and other situations in which dithering is not required. Intent: Graphic ICC name: Saturation

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfGamutMappingIntent.LCS_GM_GRAPHICS
member.summary: Specifies that a colorimetric match SHOULD be maintained. Typically used for graphic designs and named colors. Intent: Proof ICC name: Relative Colorimetric

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfGamutMappingIntent.LCS_GM_IMAGES
member.summary: Specifies that contrast SHOULD be maintained. Typically used for photographs and natural images. Intent: Picture ICC name: Perceptual

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfHatchStyle
member.summary: The HatchStyle Enumeration specifies the hatch pattern.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfHatchStyle.Horizontal
member.summary: A horizontal hatch

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfHatchStyle.Vertical
member.summary: A vertical hatch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfHatchStyle.Fdiagonal
member.summary: A 45-degree downward, left-to-right hatch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfHatchStyle.Bdiagonal
member.summary: A 45-degree upward, left-to-right hatch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfHatchStyle.Cross
member.summary: A horizontal and vertical cross-hatch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfHatchStyle.Diagcross
member.summary: The A 45-degree crosshatch.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfLogicalColorSpaceEnum
member.summary: The LogicalColorSpace Enumeration specifies the type of color space.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfLogicalColorSpaceEnum.LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB
member.summary: Color values are calibrated red green blue (RGB) values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfLogicalColorSpaceEnum.LCS_sRGB
member.summary: The value is an encoding of the ASCII characters "sRGB", and it indicates that the color values are sRGB values.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfLogicalColorSpaceEnum.LCS_WINDOWS_COLOR_SPACE
member.summary: The value is an encoding of the ASCII characters "Win ", including the trailing space, and it indicates that the color values are Windows default color space values.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMapMode
member.summary: The map modes

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMapMode.Text
member.summary: The text Each logical unit is mapped to one device pixel. Positive x is to the right; positive y is down

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMapMode.Lometric
member.summary: The lometric Each logical unit is mapped to 0.1 millimeter. Positive x is to the right; positive y is up.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMapMode.Himetric
member.summary: The himetric Each logical unit is mapped to 0.01 millimeter. Positive x is to the right; positive y is up.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMapMode.Loenglish
member.summary: The loenglish Each logical unit is mapped to 0.01 inch. Positive x is to the right; positive y is up.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMapMode.Hienglish
member.summary: The hienglish Each logical unit is mapped to 0.001 inch. Positive x is to the right; positive y is up.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMapMode.Twips
member.summary: The twips Each logical unit is mapped to one twentieth (1/20) of a point. In printing, a point is 1/72 of an inch; therefore, 1/20 of a point is 1/1440 of an inch. This unit is also known as a "twip".

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMapMode.Isotropic
member.summary: The isotropic Logical units are mapped to arbitrary device units with equally scaled axes; that is, one unit along the x-axis is equal to one unit along the y-axis. The META_SETWINDOWEXT and META_SETVIEWPORTEXT records specify the units and the orientation of the axes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMapMode.Anisotropic
member.summary: The anisotropic Logical units are mapped to arbitrary units with arbitrarily scaled axes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes
member.summary: The MetafileEscapes Enumeration specifies printer driver functionality that might not be directly accessible through WMF records defined in the RecordType Enumeration (section 2.1.1.1).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.Newframe
member.summary: Notifies the printer driver that the application has finished writing to a page.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.Abortdoc
member.summary: Stops processing the current document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.Nextband
member.summary: Notifies the printer driver that the application has finished writing to a band.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.Setcolortable
member.summary: Sets color table values.

member.summary: Sets the application-defined function that allows a print job to be canceled during printing.

member.summary: Notifies the printer driver that a new print job is starting.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.Enddoc
member.summary: Notifies the printer driver that the current print job is ending.

member.summary: Gets the device units currently configured on an output device.

member.summary: Sets the font face name on a device.

member.summary: Opens a path.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.ClipToPath
member.summary: Defines a clip region that is bounded by a path. The input MUST be a 16-bit quantity that defines the action to take.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.EndPath
member.summary: Ends a path.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.OpenChannel
member.summary: The same as STARTDOC specified with a NULL document and output filename, data in raw mode, and a type of zero.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.Downloadheader
member.summary: Instructs the printer driver to download sets of PostScript procedures.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.CloseChannel
member.summary: The same as ENDDOC. See OPEN_CHANNEL.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.PostscriptPassthrough
member.summary: Sends arbitrary data directly to a printer driver, which is expected to process this data only when in PostScript mode. .

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.EncapsulatedPostscript
member.summary: Sends arbitrary data directly to the printer driver.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.PostscriptIdentify
member.summary: Sets the printer driver to either PostScript or GDI mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.PostscriptInjection
member.summary: Inserts a block of raw data into a PostScript stream. The input MUST be a 32-bit quantity specifying the number of bytes to inject, a 16-bit quantity specifying the injection point, and a 16-bit quantity specifying the page number, followed by the bytes to inject.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.Checkjpegformat
member.summary: Checks whether the printer supports a JPEG image.

member.summary: Checks whether the printer supports a PNG image.

member.summary: Gets information on a specified feature setting for a PostScript printer driver.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.MxdcEscape
member.summary: Enables applications to write documents to a file or to a printer in XML Paper Specification (XPS) format.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileEscapes.Spclpassthrough2
member.summary: Enables applications to include private procedures and other arbitrary data in documents.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileVersion
member.summary: The MetafileVersion Enumeration defines values that specify support for device-independent bitmaps (DIBs) in metafiles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileVersion.METAVERSION100
member.summary: DIBs are not supported.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMetafileVersion.METAVERSION300
member.summary: DIBs are supported.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMixMode
member.summary: The MixMode Enumeration specifies the background mix mode for text, hatched brushes, and other nonsolid pen styles.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMixMode.Transparent
member.summary: The background remains untouched.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfMixMode.Opaque
member.summary: The background is filled with the background color that is currently defined in the playback device context before the text, hatched brush, or pen is drawn.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision
member.summary: The OutPrecision enumeration defines values for output precision, which is the requirement for the font mapper to match specific font parameters, including height, width, character orientation, escapement, pitch, and font type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.Default
member.summary: A value that specifies default behavior.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.String
member.summary: A value that is returned when rasterized fonts are enumerated.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.Stroke
member.summary: A value that is returned when TrueType and other outline fonts, and vector fonts are enumerated.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.Tt
member.summary: A value that specifies the choice of a TrueType font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.Device
member.summary: A value that specifies the choice of a device font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.Raster
member.summary: A value that specifies the choice of a rasterized font when the system contains multiple fonts with the same name.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.TtOnly
member.summary: A value that specifies the requirement for only TrueType fonts. If there are no TrueType fonts installed in the system, default behavior is specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.Outline
member.summary: A value that specifies the requirement for TrueType and other outline fonts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.ScreenOutline
member.summary: A value that specifies a preference for TrueType and other outline fonts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfOutPrecision.PsOnly
member.summary: A value that specifies a requirement for only PostScript fonts. If there are no PostScript fonts installed in the system, default behavior is specified.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle
member.summary: The 16-bit PenStyle Enumeration is used to specify different types of pens that can be used in graphics operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Cosmetic
member.summary: The cosmetic

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.EndcapRound
member.summary: The line end caps are round.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.JoinRound
member.summary: Line joins are round.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Solid
member.summary: The pen is solid.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Dash
member.summary: The pen is dashed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Dot
member.summary: The pen is dotted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Dashdot
member.summary: The pen has alternating dashes and dots.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Dashdotdot
member.summary: The pen has dashes and double dots.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Null
member.summary: The pen is invisible.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Insideframe
member.summary: The pen is solid. When this pen is used in any drawing record that takes a bounding rectangle, the dimensions of the figure are shrunk so that it fits entirely in the bounding rectangle, taking into account the width of the pen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Userstyle
member.summary: The pen uses a styling array supplied by the user.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.Alternate
member.summary: The pen sets every other pixel (this style is applicable only for cosmetic pens).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.EndcapSquare
member.summary: Line end caps are square.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.EndcapFlat
member.summary: Line end caps are flat.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.JoinBevel
member.summary: Line joins are beveled.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPenStyle.JoinMiter
member.summary: Line joins are mitered when they are within the current limit set by the SETMITERLIMIT META_ESCAPE record. A join is beveled when it would exceed the limit.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPitchFont
member.summary: The PitchFont enumeration defines values that are used for specifying characteristics of a font. The values are used to indicate whether the characters in a font have a fixed or variable width, or pitch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPitchFont.DEFAULT_PITCH
member.summary: The default pitch, which is implementation-dependent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPitchFont.FIXED_PITCH
member.summary: A fixed pitch, which means that all the characters in the font occupy the same width when output in a string.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPitchFont.VARIABLE_PITCH
member.summary: A variable pitch, which means that the characters in the font occupy widths that are proportional to the actual widths of the glyphs when output in a string. For example, the "i" and space characters usually have much smaller widths than a "W" or "O" character.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPolyFillMode
member.summary: The PolyFillMode Enumeration specifies the method used for filling a polygon.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPolyFillMode.Alternate
member.summary: Selects alternate mode (fills the area between odd-numbered and even-numbered polygon sides on each scan line).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPolyFillMode.Winding
member.summary: Selects winding mode (fills any region with a nonzero winding value)

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPostScriptCap
member.summary: The PostScriptCap Enumeration defines line-ending types for use with a PostScript printer driver.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPostScriptCap.PostScriptNotSet
member.summary: Specifies that the line-ending style has not been set, and that a default style MAY [24] be used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPostScriptCap.PostScriptFlatCap
member.summary: Specifies that the line ends at the last point. The end is squared off.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPostScriptCap.PostScriptRoundCap
member.summary: Specifies a circular cap. The center of the circle is the last point in the line. The diameter of the circle is the same as the line width; that is, the thickness of the line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPostScriptCap.PostScriptSquareCap
member.summary: Specifies a square cap. The center of the square is the last point in the line. The height and width of the square are the same as the line width; that is, the thickness of the line.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPostScriptClipping
member.summary: The PostScriptClipping Enumeration defines functions that can be applied to the clipping path used for PostScript output.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPostScriptClipping.CLIP_SAVE
member.summary: Saves the current PostScript clipping path.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPostScriptClipping.CLIP_RESTORE
member.summary: Restores the PostScript clipping path to the last clipping path that was saved by a previous CLIP_SAVE function applied by a CLIP_TO_PATH record (section 2.3.6.6).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfPostScriptClipping.CLIP_INCLUSIVE
member.summary: Intersects the current PostScript clipping path with the current clipping path and saves the result as the new PostScript clipping path.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation
member.summary: Enumeration specifies ternary raster operation codes, which define how to combine the bits in a source bitmap with the bits in a destination bitmap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.BLACKNESS
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index 0 in the physical palette. (This color is black for the default physical palette.)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.NOTSRCERASE
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean OR operator and then inverts the resultant color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.NOTSRCCOPY
member.summary: Copies the inverted source rectangle to the destination.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.SRCERASE
member.summary: Combines the inverted colors of the destination rectangle with the colors of the source rectangle by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.DSTINVERT
member.summary: Inverts the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.PATINVERT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the brush currently selected in hdcDest, with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.SRCINVERT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.SRCAND
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.MERGEPAINT
member.summary: Merges the colors of the inverted source rectangle with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.MERGECOPY
member.summary: Merges the colors of the source rectangle with the brush currently selected in hdcDest, by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.SRCCOPY
member.summary: Copies the source rectangle directly to the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.SRCPAINT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.PATCOPY
member.summary: Copies the brush currently selected in hdcDest, into the destination bitmap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.PATPAINT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the brush currently selected in hdcDest, with the colors of the inverted source rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator. The result of this operation is combined with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperation.WHITENESS
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index 1 in the physical palette. (This color is white for the default physical palette.)

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperationOperand
member.summary: Each ternary raster operation code represents a Boolean operation in which the values of the pixels in the source, the selected brush, and the destination are combined. Following are the three operands used in these operations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperationOperand.D
member.summary: Destination bitmap

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperationOperand.P
member.summary: Selected brush (also called pattern)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperationOperand.S
member.summary: Source bitmap

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperationOperand.a
member.summary: Bitwise AND

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperationOperand.n
member.summary: Bitwise NOT (inverse)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperationOperand.o
member.summary: Bitwise OR

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTernaryRasterOperationOperand.x
member.summary: Bitwise exclusive OR (XOR)

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags
member.summary: TextAlignmentMode Flags specify the relationship between a reference point and a bounding rectangle, for text alignment. These flags can be combined to specify multiple options, with the restriction that only one flag can be chosen that alters the drawing position in the playback device context. Horizontal text alignment is performed when the font has a horizontal default baseline.
member.remarks: TextAlignmentMode flags specify three different components of text alignment: - The horizontal position of the reference point is determined by TA_RIGHT and TA_CENTER; if those bits are clear, the alignment MUST be TA_LEFT. - The vertical position of the reference point is determined by TA_BOTTOM and TA_BASELINE; if those bits are clear, the alignment MUST be TA_TOP. - Whether to update the output position in the playback device context after text output is determined by TA_UPDATECP; if that bit is clear, the position MUST NOT be updated. This is the reason for defining three different zero values in the enumeration; they represent the default states of the three components of text alignment.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Noupdatecp
member.summary: The drawing position in the playback device context MUST NOT be updated after each text output call. The reference point MUST be passed to the text output function.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Left
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the left edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Top
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the top edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Updatecp
member.summary: The drawing position in the playback device context MUST be updated after each text output call. It MUST be used as the reference point.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Right
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the right edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Center
member.summary: The reference point MUST be aligned horizontally with the center of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Bottom
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the bottom edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Baseline
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the baseline of the text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Rtlreading
member.summary: The text MUST be laid out in right-to-left reading order, instead of the default left-to right order. This SHOULD be applied only when the font that is defined in the playback device context is either Hebrew or Arabic.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Horizontal
member.summary: Represents Horisontal text algin sets (Left | Right | Center)

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfTextAlignmentModeFlags.Vertical
member.summary: Represents Vertical text algin sets (Top | Bottom | Baseline)

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfVerticalTextAlignmentModeFlags
member.summary: VerticalTextAlignmentMode Flags specify the relationship between a reference point and a bounding rectangle, for text alignment. These flags can be combined to specify multiple options, with the restriction that only one flag can be chosen that alters the drawing position in the playback device context. Vertical text alignment is performed when the font has a vertical default baseline, such as Kanji.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfVerticalTextAlignmentModeFlags.VTA_TOP
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the top edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfVerticalTextAlignmentModeFlags.VTA_RIGHT
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the right edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfVerticalTextAlignmentModeFlags.VTA_BOTTOM
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the bottom edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfVerticalTextAlignmentModeFlags.VTA_CENTER
member.summary: The reference point MUST be aligned vertically with the center of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfVerticalTextAlignmentModeFlags.VTA_LEFT
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the left edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Consts.WmfVerticalTextAlignmentModeFlags.VTA_BASELINE
member.summary: The reference point MUST be on the baseline of the text.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile
member.summary: The Escape Enhanced Meta file record.

member.summary: The escape record base.

member.summary: The base wmf object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeRecordBase.ByteCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the byte count.
member.value: A 16-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the record data that follows. This value MUST be 34 plus the value of the EnhancedMetafileDataSize field.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeRecordBase.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeRecordBase.Checked
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is checked.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.CommentIdentifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the comment identifier.
member.value: A 32-bit unsigned integer that defines this record as a WMF Comment record. This value MUST be 0x43464D57.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.CommentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the comment.
member.value: A 32-bit unsigned integer that identifies the type of comment in this record. This value MUST be 0x00000001.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version.
member.value: A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies EMF metafile interoperability. This SHOULD be 0x00010000

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.Checksum
member.summary: Gets or sets the checksum.
member.value: A 16-bit unsigned integer used to validate the correctness of the embedded EMF stream. This value MUST be the one's-complement of the result of applying an XOR operation to all WORDs in the EMF stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets the flags.
member.value: This 32-bit unsigned integer is unused and MUST be set to zero.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.CommentRecordCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the comment record count.
member.value: A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the total number of consecutive META_ESCAPE_ENHANCED_METAFILE records that contain the embedded EMF metafile.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.CurrentRecordSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the current record.
member.value: A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the EnhancedMetafileData field. This value MUST be less than or equal to 8,192.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.RemainingBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the remaining bytes.
member.value: A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of bytes in the EMF stream that remain to be processed after this record. Those additional EMF bytes MUST follow in the EnhancedMetafileData fields of subsequent META_ESCAPE_ENHANDED_METAFILE escape records.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.EnhancedMetafileDataSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the enhanced metafile data.
member.value: A 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the total size of the EMF stream embedded in this sequence of META_ESCAPE_ENHANCED_METAFILE records.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.EscapeRecords.WmfEscapeEnhancedMetafile.EnhancedMetafileData
member.summary: Gets or sets the enhanced metafile data.
member.value: A segment of an EMF file. The bytes in consecutive META_ESCAPE_ENHANCED_METAFILE records MUST be concatenated to represent the entire embedded EMF file.

member.summary: The META_BITBLT record specifies the transfer of a block of pixels according to a raster operation. The destination of the transfer is the current output region in the playback device context.

member.summary: The base bitmap header class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapBaseHeader.HeaderSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that defines the size of this object, in bytes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapBaseHeader.Planes

member.summary: The BitmapCoreHeader Object contains information about the dimensions and color format of a device-independent bitmap(DIB).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapCoreHeader.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that defines the of the DIB, in pixels

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapCoreHeader.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-bit unsigned integer that defines the of the DIB, in pixels

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader
member.summary: The BitmapInfoHeader Object contains information about the dimensions and color format of a device-independent bitmap (DIB).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader.StructureSize
member.summary: The structure size

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that defines the width of the DIB, in pixels. This value MUST be positive. This field SHOULD specify the width of the decompressed image file, if the Compression value specifies JPEG or PNG format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets 32-bit signed integer that defines the height of the DIB, in pixels. This value MUST NOT be zero. If this value is positive, the DIB is a bottom-up bitmap, and its origin is the lower-left corner. If this value is negative, the DIB is a top-down bitmap, and its origin is the upper-left corner. Top-down bitmaps do not support compression. This field SHOULD specify the height of the decompressed image file, if the Compression value specifies JPEG or PNG format.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader.Compression
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that defines the compression mode of the DIB. This value MUST be in the Compression Enumeration (section 2.1.1.7). This value MUST NOT specify a compressed format if the DIB is a top-down bitmap, as indicated by the Height value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader.ImageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that defines the size, in bytes, of the image. If the Compression value is BI_RGB, this value SHOULD be zero and MUST be ignored. If the Compression value is BI_JPEG or BI_PNG, this value MUST specify the size of the JPEG or PNG image buffer, respectively.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader.XPelsPerMeter
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that defines the horizontal resolution, in pixels-per-meter, of the target device for the DIB

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader.YPelsPerMeter

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader.ColorUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the number of indexes in the color table used by the DIB, as follows: If this value is zero, the DIB uses the maximum number of colors that correspond to the BitCount value. If this value is nonzero and the BitCount value is less than 16, this value specifies the number of colors used by the DIB. If this value is nonzero and the BitCount value is 16 or greater, this value specifies the size of the color table used to optimize performance of the system palette. Note If this value is nonzero and greater than the maximum possible size of the color table based on the BitCount value, the maximum color table size SHOULD be assumed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfBitmapInfoHeader.ColorImportant
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that defines the number of color indexes that are required for displaying the DIB. If this value is zero, all color indexes are required

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace
member.summary: The LogColorSpace object specifies a logical color space for the playback device context, which can be the name of a color profile in ASCII characters.
member.remarks: The Endpoints, GammaRed, GammaGreen, and GammaBlue fields are used to specify a logical color space. The Endpoints field is a CIEXYZTriple object that contains the x, y, and z values of the RGB endpoint of the color space. The relation between tri-stimulus values X,Y,Z and chromaticity values x,y,z is expressed as follows. x = X/(X+Y+Z) y = Y/(X+Y+Z) z = Z/(X+Y+Z) The GammaRed, GammaGreen, and GammaBlue fields contain values in "8.8 fixed point" format, which is a technique for representing non-integer numbers. Each value consists of a zeroextended 8-bit magnitude followed by an 8-bit fraction, with the combined 16 bits left-shifted by 8 bits. Thus, in 32-bits, the real value N.F is 00000000nnnnnnnnffffffff00000000, where "nnnnnnnn" and "ffffffff" are binary representations of N and F, respectively. For example, for the real number 10.5, nnnnnnnn would be 00001010 (binary 10) and ffffffff would be 00000101 (binary 5), and the complete 32-bit binary value would be 00000000000010100000010100000000, which is the hexadecimal value 0x0A50.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the of color space objects; it MUST be set to the value 0x50534F43, which is the ASCII encoding of the string "PSOC".

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that defines a number; it MUST be0x00000400.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that defines the of this object, in bytes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.ColorSpaceType
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the color space type. It MUST be defined in the LogicalColorSpace enumeration (section 2.1.1.14). If this value is LCS_sRGB or LCS_WINDOWS_COLOR_SPACE, the sRGB color space MUST be used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.Intent
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that defines the gamut mapping intent. It MUST be defined in the GamutMappingIntent enumeration (section 2.1.1.11).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.Endpoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a CIEXYZTriple object (section 2.2.2.7) that defines the CIE chromaticity x, y, and z coordinates of the three colors that correspond to the RGB for the logical color space associated with the bitmap. If the field does not specify LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.GammaRed
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit fixed point value that defines the toned response curve for red. If the field does not specify LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.GammaGreen
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit fixed point value that defines the toned response curve for green. If the field does not specify LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.GammaBlue
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit fixed point value that defines the toned response curve for blue. If the field does not specify LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpace.Filename
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional, ASCII charactger string that specifies the name of a file that contains a color profile. If a file name is specified, and the field is set to LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, the other fields of this structure SHOULD be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW
member.summary: The LogColorSpaceW object specifies a logical color space, which can be defined by a color profile file with a name consisting of Unicode 16-bit characters.
member.remarks: See the object (section 2.2.2.11) for additional details concerning the interpretation of field values of this object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that specifies the of color space objects; it MUST be set to the value 0x50534F43, which is the ASCII encoding of the string "PSOC".

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that defines a number; it MUST be0x00000400.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit unsigned integer that defines the of this object, in bytes.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.ColorSpaceType
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the color space type. It MUST be defined in the LogicalColorSpace enumeration (section 2.1.1.14). If this value is LCS_sRGB or LCS_WINDOWS_COLOR_SPACE, the sRGB color space MUST be used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.Intent
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit signed integer that defines the gamut mapping intent. It MUST be defined in the GamutMappingIntent enumeration (section 2.1.1.11).

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.Endpoints
member.summary: Gets or sets a CIEXYZTriple object (section 2.2.2.7) that defines the CIE chromaticity x, y, and z coordinates of the three colors that correspond to the RGB for the logical color space associated with the bitmap. If the field does not specify LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.GammaRed
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit fixed point value that defines the toned response curve for red. If the field does not specify LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.GammaGreen
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit fixed point value that defines the toned response curve for green. If the field does not specify LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.GammaBlue
member.summary: Gets or sets a 32-bit fixed point value that defines the toned response curve for blue. If the field does not specify LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfLogColorSpaceW.Filename
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional, null-terminated Unicode UTF16-LE character string, which specifies the name of a file that contains a color profile. If a file name is specified, and the field is set to LCS_CALIBRATED_RGB, the other fields of this structure SHOULD be ignored.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfMoveTo
member.summary: The META_MOVETO record sets the output position in the playback device context to a specified point.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Wmf.Objects.WmfOffsetWindowOrg

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.OpenDocument.Enums.OdGradientStyle
member.summary: The gradient style

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.OpenDocument.Enums.OdGradientStyle.Axial
member.summary: The axial defines a bi-linear gradient that is also known as reflected gradient or mirrored linear gradient. It is created as a linear gradient that is mirrored (or reflected) along its axis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.OpenDocument.Enums.OdGradientStyle.Ellipsoid
member.summary: The ellipsoid defines a gradient where the colors are blend along the radius from the center of an ellipsoid as defined with the draw:cx and draw:cy attributes. The length of the semi major-axis is the width of the filled area and the length of the semi-minor

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.OpenDocument.Enums.OdGradientStyle.Linear
member.summary: The linear defines a gradient where the colors blend along the linear axis of the gradient. The axis of the gradient is specified with the draw:angle attribute clockwise to the vertical axis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.OpenDocument.Enums.OdGradientStyle.Radial
member.summary: The radial defines a gradient where the colors are blend along the radius from the center of a circle as defined with the draw:cx and draw:cy attributes. The outside of the circle is filled with the end color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.OpenDocument.Enums.OdGradientStyle.Rectangle
member.summary: The rectangle defines a gradient that produces a rectangular blend from the center of the rectangle to the shortest of the 4 borders. The center of the rectangle is defined with the attributes draw:cx and draw:cy. The width of the rectangle is the width of the filled area, the height of the rectangle is the height of the filled area. The outside of the square is filled with the end color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.OpenDocument.Enums.OdGradientStyle.Square
member.summary: The square defines a gradient that produces a square blend, imitating the visual perspective in a corridor or the aerial view of a pyramid. Also known as "box gradient" and "pyramidal gradient". The center of the square is defined with the draw:cx and draw:cy attributes. The width and height of the square is the minimum value of either the width or the height of the filled area. The outside of the square is filled with the end color.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.OpenDocument.Enums.OdGradientStyle.None
member.summary: The gradient style is none

member.summary: The namespace handles Png file format processing.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngColorType
member.summary: Represents the PNG image color type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngColorType.Grayscale
member.summary: Represents the color type where each pixel is a greyscale sample.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngColorType.Truecolor
member.summary: Represents the color type where each pixel is an R,G,B triple.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngColorType.IndexedColor
member.summary: Represents the color type where each pixel is a palette index; a PLTE chunk shall appear.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngColorType.GrayscaleWithAlpha
member.summary: Represents the color type where each pixel is a greyscale sample followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngColorType.TruecolorWithAlpha
member.summary: Represents the color type where each pixel is an R,G,B triple followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType
member.summary: The png filter type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType.None
member.summary: The null-filter, means no filtering for image data rows.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType.Sub
member.summary: The sub filter, means substractive filtering will be applied to image data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType.Up
member.summary: The up filter, means row-by-row substraction filter will be applied.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType.Avg
member.summary: The avg filter, means, that average filter will be applied to image data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType.Paeth
member.summary: The paeth predictor filter.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType.Adaptive
member.summary: Adaptive filtering, means that saving process will choose most sutable filter for each data row. Best compression, slowest execution time.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngImage.GetOriginalOptions
member.summary: Gets the options based on the original file settings. This can be helpful to keep bit-depth and other parameters of the original image unchanged. For example, if we load a black-white PNG image with 1 bit per pixel and then save it using the method, the output PNG image with 8-bit per pixel will be produced. To avoid it and save PNG image with 1-bit per pixel, use this method to get corresponding saving options and pass them to the method as the second parameter.
member.returns: The options based on the original file settings.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Psd.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Defines the compression method used for image data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Psd.CompressionMethod.Raw
member.summary: No compression. The image data stored as raw bytes in RGBA planar order. That means that first all R data is written, then all G is written, then all B and finally all A data is written.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Psd.CompressionMethod.RLE
member.summary: RLE compressed the image data starts with the byte counts for all the scan lines (rows * channels), with each count stored as a two-byte value. The RLE compressed data follows, with each scan line compressed separately. The RLE compression is the same compression algorithm used by the Macintosh ROM routine PackBits and the TIFF standard.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Psd.CompressionMethod.ZipWithoutPrediction
member.summary: ZIP without prediction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Psd.CompressionMethod.ZipWithPrediction
member.summary: ZIP with prediction.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Psd.Layers.LayerResources.CurvResource
member.summary: Class CurvResource. Resource of Curves Adjustment Layer 1 byte - 0 if use curves, 1 if used pixels on map if 0 then: 2 bytes - short. Default is 1 4 bytes - int. Used only last byte by bit. First bit is for 1 channel, the Fourth bit for 4 channel for example 2 bytes - short points count 4 bytes * count of point - points of curve 2 short: first position, second height 4 bytes - word "Crv " 2 bytes - short default is 4 for Curves 4 bytes - int. Default is 1 4 bytes - point count 4 bytes * point count - points of curve 2 short: first position, second height 0-4 bytes - Leading to be fold for four if 1 then: 2 bytes - short. Default is 1 4 bytes - int. Used only last byte. One channel is in one bit. First bit is for 1 channel, the Fourth bit for 4 channel for example 256 * count of changed channels - ordered values of channel in range 0 - 255 4 bytes - word "Crv " 2 bytes - short. Default is 3 for pixels on map 4 bytes - int Channel count (2 + 256) bytes - short 2 for channel index, 256 is ordered values of channel in range 0 - 255

member.summary: Psd load options

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageLoadOptions.PsdLoadOptions.LoadEffectsResource
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [load effects resource] (by default resource is not loaded). When set this option only supported effects will be rendered to final merged image.
member.value: true if [load effects resource]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageLoadOptions.PsdLoadOptions.UseDiskForLoadEffectsResource
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [use disk for load effects resource] (by default used disk to load effects resource, but can be used memory if it is enought by setting this value to false).
member.value: true if [use disk for load effects resource]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageLoadOptions.PsdLoadOptions.ReadOnlyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [use read only mode]. This is read-only mode, supported for identical compatibility with Adobe Photoshop. When this option is set, all changes applied for layers will not be saved to final image. All data is used from ImageData section, so it is identical to Photoshop. By default all loaded images are not identical to Adobe Photoshop compatible.
member.value: true if [use photoshop compatibility mode]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageLoadOptions.PsdLoadOptions.DefaultReplacementFont
P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageLoadOptions.PsdLoadOptions.IgnoreTextLayerWidthOnUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether PSD text layer fixed width will be ignored on UpdateText operation execution.
member.value: true if [ignore text layer width]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageLoadOptions.PsdLoadOptions.IgnoreAlphaChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [ignore alpha channel].
member.value: true if [ignore alpha channel]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.PsdOptions.RemoveGlobalTextEngineResource
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether - Remove the global text engine resource - Used for some text-layered psd files, in only case, when they can not be opened in Adobe Photoshop after processing (mostly for absent fonts text layers related). After using this option, user need to Make next in opened in Photoshop file: Menu "Text" -> "Process absent fonts". After that operation all text will appear again. Please note, that this operation may cause some final layout changes.
member.value: true if [remove global text engine resource]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.PsdOptions.RefreshImagePreviewData
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [refresh image preview data] - option used to maximize compatibility with another PSD image viewers. Please note, text layers drawing to final layout is not supported for Compact Framework platform
member.value: true if [refresh image preview data]; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Tiff.TiffExifIfd
member.summary: The TIFF Exif image file directory class.
member.remarks: Incapsulates a pointer to the Exif IFD. Interoperability, Exif IFD has the same structure as that of the IFD specified in TIFF. ordinarily, however, it does not contain image data as in the case of TIFF. See http://www.exiv2.org/tags.html and http://www.awaresystems.be/imaging/tiff/tifftags/exififd.html for more details.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.TiffOptions
member.summary: The tiff file format options. Note that width and height tags will get overwritten on image creation by width and height parameters so there is no need to specify them directly. Note that many options return a default value but that does not mean that this option is set explicitly as a tag value. To verify the tag is present use Tags property or the corresponding IsTagPresent method.
member.developer_tip: WARNING! never modify tiff options during save since this may cause side effects and hard to find bugs. The following line was specially left commented since it caused incorrect determination of data beginning. The passed options did not contain spp (although the options are not correct in such case but still this scenario causes errors) and the next line caused +spp tag +bpp tag added and when options were written after data completely written they have overwritten the data beginning for uncompressed codec!!! See TiffUncompressedCodec.Encode. this.Options.SamplesPerPixel = 3;
